trs: Give me the bread!
Give him the bread!
Hit yourself!
Always work! [ET]
Be / get / continue speaking!' [ET]
Come in!' [overheard]
Get sweating! (e.g. do the hard work yourself)' [ET]
Act tired!' [ET]
Stop exaggerating!' [overheard]

Hide him [Hare] in the room, we shall slaughter him.' [Saliki and Hare]
\lq Open the door!' [overheard]
Go buy [vouchers for] electricity!' [overheard]\footnotemark

src: ʊ-jʊ lɪnga i-kʊ-m-boni-a, \textbf{aa}-\textbf{seng}-\textbf{ege} taasi n=ɪ-n-dwanga pa-kɪ-kosi po \textbf{a}-\textbf{m}-\textbf{boni}-\textbf{ege}
trs: Whoever greets me shall first hit me with an axe in the neck, then he shall greet me.' [Chief Kapyungu]
Then Skunk said ``You, it [meat] is done. Come, let's eat!''{}' [Hare and Skunk]
\lq Hey, listen up!' [ET]
\lq Come, let's rest!' [ET]
\lq Let's go! (urging and/or annoyed)' [ET]

src: a-lɪ koo=kʊʊgʊ kajamba? keet-a, n-ga-m̩-bon-a ʊ-kw-is-a kʊ-kʊ-n-geet-a. \textbf{na}=\textbf{mu}-\textbf{bʊʊk}-\textbf{e}, \textbf{mu}-\textbf{ka}-\textbf{n}-\textbf{koolel}-\textbf{e}, \textbf{mu}-\textbf{ka}-\textbf{n̩}-\textbf{dond}-\textbf{e}! iis-e a-n-geet-e
trs: Where is Tortoise?  ‎‎Look, I haven't seen it coming to see me.  ‎‎Go (pl.) right now, call it, find it! It must come and see me.' [Lion and Tortoise]

src: j-oope ʊ-n-kiikʊlʊ \textbf{a}-\textbf{j}-\textbf{ege} n=ɪ-n-dwanga ɪ-j-aa kʊ-meny-el-a n=ʊ-kʊ-tumul-ɪl-a ɪ-mi-piki
trs: \lq And a woman should have an axe for splitting with and cutting trees with.' [Types of tools in the home]

src: a-ka-a bʊ-bɪlɪ a-ma-pamba a-ga-a kʊ-jeng-el-a \textbf{gw}-\textbf{ijʊʊl}-\textbf{e} ʊ-kʊ-fyatʊl-a jʊ$\sim$jʊʊ-gwe n=ʊ-kʊ-kosy-a
trs: \lq ‎‎Secondly, you should try yourself to make bricks to build with and bake them.' [How to build modern houses]
‎‎What should we do with our children!' [Thieving monkeys]

src: lɪlɪno kʊʊ-many-a, fi-ki ʊ-ti-kw-amul-a bo n-gʊ-kʊ-laalʊʊsy-a? bʊle \textbf{n}-\textbf{gʊ}-\textbf{kom}-\textbf{e} n=ɪ-kɪ-buli?
trs: Now you'll get to know me, why don't you answer when I'm asking you? Should I hit you with the fist?' [Saliki and Hare];
May God help you.' [overheard]

src: ʊ-n-nino iibiibwe fi-mo kʊ-no mw-a-jaat-aga, a-t-ile \textbf{n}-\textbf{ummw}-\textbf{ag}-\textbf{ege} papaa$\sim$pa
trs: Your friend has forgotten something while you were talking a walk, he said ``I want to meet him right here.''{}' [Hare and Spider]

src: po mwa=n-gambɪlɪ a-a-tɪ ``hee. po \textbf{m}-\textbf{bʊʊk}-\textbf{e} kw-a kajamba kʊ-kʊ-mel-a ɪɪ-heela sy-angʊ''. po a-lɪnkw-end-a,  a-lɪnkw-end-a,  a-lɪnkw-end-a
trs: So Mr. Monkey said \textup{\lq\lq}I'll go to Tortoise to claim my money\textup{''}. He walked and walked and walked' [Monkey and Tortoise] %genau dieses bsp leider vllt schon verwendet; aber dort im weiteren Kontext, hier noch OK
I promise that I will come tomorrow.' [ET]

src: kangɪ \textbf{mpaka} \textbf{ʊ}-\textbf{si}-\textbf{keet}-\textbf{e} taasi ɪ-n-dalama ɪ-si ʊ-lɪ na=syo muu-nyambɪ, pamopeene n=ʊ-tʊ-ndʊ ʊ-tʊ-ngɪ ʊ-tʊ tʊ-bagiile ʊ-kʊ-kʊ-tʊʊl-a kʊ-m-bombo ɪ-jo
trs: Again, you should look first at the money which you have in your pocket, together with other things which can help you in this work.' [How to build modern houses]

src: po ly-a-pɪmb-aga ii-pango po$\sim$p-oosa pa-la li-kʊ-bʊʊk-a. po ly-and-aga ʊ-kʊ-kʊb-a ii-pango lɪ-la. po a-ba-ndʊ \textbf{ba}-\textbf{mog}-\textbf{ege}
trs: \lq It (the monster) carried the guitar wherever it went. It would begin to play that guitar. People would then dance.' [Monster with guitar]

src: paapo mwe ba-ana ʊ-mwe mu-lɪ ba-pɪɪna, ba-li=ko a-ba-nyambala ba-mo a-ba b-isakʊ-ba-syob-aga n=ʊ-kʊ-peefy-a
trs: \lq Because your are orphans, there are some men who might try to persuade you.

src: \textbf{ba}-\textbf{ba}-\textbf{p}-\textbf{ege} ɪ-fi-ndʊ n=ʊ-tʊ-ndʊ ʊ-tʊ-ngɪ ʊkʊtɪ mu-logw-ege na=bo
trs: \lq They will give you food and presents so that you have sex with them.' [Kande's Story]\footnotemark

src: gwe n-kiikʊlʊ \textbf{ʊ}-\textbf{n̩}-\textbf{jab}-\textbf{ɪl}-\textbf{ege} ʊ-n̩-dʊmego ɪ-kɪ-jabo kɪ-nywamu fiijo
trs: You, woman must always [while pregnant] give your husband a good share [of the food].' [Pregnant women]

src: ɪɪ-fubu j-aal-iitiike looli jɪ-lɪnkʊ-n-sʊʊm-a jɪ-lɪnkʊ-tɪ, ``\textbf{gw}-\textbf{is}-\textbf{enge}=\textbf{ko} kʊ-my-angʊ kʊ-kʊ-m-band-a ɪ-fi-londa
trs: Hippo agreed, but asked him [Hare], \textup{\lq\lq}You should come (regularly) to my home to put hot compresses on my sores.\textup{''}' [Hare and Hippo]

src: a-ka-a kw-and-a \textbf{g}-\textbf{ʊʊl}-\textbf{ege} a-ma-lata manandɪ$\sim$ma-nandɪ, mpaka ga-fik-ɪl-e ɪ-m-balɪlo ɪ-jɪ kʊ-jɪ-lond-a
trs: To start with, you should be buying corrugated iron, little by little, until you have enough.' [How to build modern houses]

src: n-gʊ-kʊ-bʊʊl-a mu-ndʊ ʊ-gwe, \textbf{gw}-\textbf{eg}-\textbf{ege} fy-osa ɪ-fy-ako ɪ-fi ʊ-lɪ na=fyo pamopeene n=ʊ-n-kasigo na=a-ba-anaako n=ɪ-fi-nyamaana fy-ako fy-osa.
trs: I'm telling you, you should take all your belongings together with your wife and children and all your animals.

src: \textbf{ʊ}-\textbf{bʊʊk}-\textbf{ege} kʊ-bʊ-tali komma ʊ-kʊ-buj-a kangɪ kʊ-no, ʊ-nga-ba-bʊʊl-aga na=a-ba-palamani ba-ako
trs: \lq You should go far and never return here, you shouldn't tell not even your neighbours.' [Selfishness kills]
\lq He wants to take one pear.' [Elisha pear story]

src: gwe n̩-ganga n-gʊ-sʊʊm-a \textbf{ʊ}-\textbf{n̩}-\textbf{dʊʊl}-\textbf{e} \textbf{ʊ}-\textbf{m}-\textbf{b}-\textbf{e}=\textbf{po} ʊ-n-kota ʊ-gw-a lʊ-gano
trs: \lq You, witch doctor, I beg you to help me, give me a love portion.' [Mfyage turns into a lion]
\lq The chief ordered everybody to come to his place.' [ET]

src: ɪ-n-galamu jɪ-lɪnkʊ-fi-bʊʊl-a ɪ-fi-nyamaana fy-osa ʊkʊtɪ \textbf{f}-\textbf{iis}-\textbf{e} kʊ-lʊ-komaano
trs: \lq Lion told all the animals to come to the meeting.' [Hare and Chameleon]
Isn't it good that you should lose weight [lit. reduce a bit] from your thighs?' [Hare and Hippo]
\lq We'd better get going.' [ET]

src: l-oope lʊ-ka-a lʊ-sumo lʊ-nunu ʊkʊtɪ ʊ-n-kiikʊlʊ \textbf{a}-\textbf{bomb}-\textbf{ege} ɪ-m-bombo n-gafu bo ʊ-n̩-dʊme a-li=ko m-ʊʊmi
trs: \lq ‎‎Also it is not good manners for a woman to do hard work while the husband is alive.' [Division of labour]
\lq He should try hard to get them (tools) until he gets them.' [Type of tools in the home]

src: po kangɪ po a-lɪnkʊ-buj-a ʊ-kw-is-a pa-ka-aja pa-kʊ-n̩-guul-ɪl-a kajamba \textbf{ʊkʊtɪ} \textbf{iis}-\textbf{e}
trs: ‎‎Then he [Monkey] returned to the home and waited for Tortoise to come.' [Monkey and Tortoise]
Hare ran fast to beat Chameleon.' [Hare and Chameleon]
They would not leave them [animals] outside so that they [animals] would get wet in the rain.' [Nyakyusa houses of long ago]

src: bo \textbf{i}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{tɪ} \textbf{a}-\textbf{kol}-\textbf{ege} ʊ-lw-igi a-lʊ-kab-e kw-a-t-ile \textup{\lq\lq}kóo\textup{''}. a-a-kuut-ile a-a-t-ile \textup{\lq\lq}ɪɪtaata! m-fw-ile hɪhɪhɪɪ\textup{''}
trs: When he tried to grab the door and get hold of it, there was the sound ``kóo!'' [of a sickle]. He cried ``Oh father! I am dead, hihihii!''{}' [Wage of the thieves]

src: kalʊlʊ a-a-hobwike fiijo paapo ʊ-n-kiikʊlʊ a-sambwike, Kalʊlʊ a-lɪnkʊ-tɪ \textup{\lq\lq}syo ɪ-si \textbf{n}-\textbf{d}-\textbf{ile} \textbf{n}-\textbf{gʊ}-\textbf{bʊʊl}-\textbf{e} ʊkʊtɪ ʊ-many-e\textup{”}
trs: Hare was very happy because the woman had changed her mind, he said ``That's what I wanted to tell you so that you know it.''{}' [Hare and Spider]

src: po leelo a-lɪnkw-is-a ʊ-gw-a bʊ-haano [...] po j-oope \textbf{a}-\textbf{lɪnkʊ}-\textbf{tɪ} \textbf{ɪmb}-\textbf{ege} ʊ-lw-ɪmbo. j-oope a-lɪnkw-ɪmb-a a-lɪnkʊ-tɪ
trs: \lq Then the fifth (child) came. It also wanted to sing the song. It also sang:' [Children and Snake]

trs: \lq ‎It is appropriate for every person to have all the things which are needed to do their work with.' [Types of tools in the home] %deontic necessity

src: mwe ba-anangʊ, lɪlɪno a-pa ʊ-n-kiikʊlʊ ʊ-jʊ a-a-lond-aga ʊ-kʊ-ba-gog-a, po \textbf{fi}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{tɪ} na=nuuswe \textbf{tʊ}-\textbf{n̩}-\textbf{gog}-\textbf{e}
trs: My children, now that this woman has tried to kill you, it is up to us to kill her.' \citep[143]{BergerP1933}
They must come so that I give them the money.' [ET]

Go grind maize!' [ET]

src: po leelo ʊ-bʊʊk-e kw-a mwa=n-gambɪlɪ \textbf{ʊ}-\textbf{ka}-\textbf{m̩}-\textbf{bʊʊl}-\textbf{e} ʊkʊtɪ ``taata i-kʊ-sʊʊm-a a-m-ungu, n=ɪ-m-bilipili na=a-ma-sɪmbɪ n=ii-seeke.''
trs: Go to Mr. Monkey and tell him ``Father begs for pumpkins, peppers, cocoyam and a sidedish.''{}

src: mu-bʊʊk-e mwe ba-ndʊ b-angʊ nuumwe \textbf{mu}-\textbf{ka}-\textbf{kol}-\textbf{e} ɪ-n-galamu \textbf{mu}-\textbf{ka}-\textbf{twal}-\textbf{e} ɪɪ-ny-ʊʊmi!
trs: You, my people, you too  go catch a lion and bring it alive!' [Chief Kapyungu]

src: po ɪɪ-sota bo jɪ-fum-ile n-kʊ-jaat-a jɪ-lɪnkʊ-tɪ \textup{\lq\lq}\textbf{n}-\textbf{ga}-\textbf{keet}-\textbf{e} ii-fumbɪ ly-angʊ\textup{''}
trs: \lq Python, when it had come from taking a walk, said \lq\lq I'll go look after my egg.''{}' [Python and woman]

src: is-aga tʊ-bʊʊk-e \textbf{tʊ}-\textbf{ka}-\textbf{m̩}-\textbf{bʊʊl}-\textbf{e} ʊ-n-kʊlʊmba gw-ɪtʊ gw-a fi-nyamaana fy-osa ɪɪ-sofu ʊkʊtɪ a-koolel-e ʊ-lʊ-komaano
trs: Come, let's go and tell our eldest among all animals, Elephant, that he should call a meeting.' [Hare and Chameleon]
\lq Don't you dare eat that food!' [ET]

srcwordshtml: aa=mu-nga-sob-esy-a
trs: \lq I'm lending it to you, but don't lose my needle.' [Chickens and crow]
\lq He told me not to work.' [ET]

src: \textbf{tʊ}-\textbf{nga}-\textbf{j}-\textbf{aga} n=ɪ-fi-nyonyo bo ɪɪ-fubu ɪ-jɪ j-aa-fw-ile kʊʊ-nongwa ɪ-j-aa fi-londa bo jɪ-kʊ-lond-a ʊ-bʊ-nunu
trs: We should not have desire like Hippo, who died because of his sores, when he was looking for beauty.' [Hare and Hippo]

src: n̩-dʊme gw-angʊ, tʊ-lond-e fi-mo ɪ-fy-a kʊ-n-teg-el-a kalʊlʊ ʊkʊtɪ ii-kol-e tʊ-n̩-gog-e. \textbf{a}-\textbf{ng}-\textbf{and}-\textbf{ɪsy}-\textbf{a} ʊ-kʊ-ly-a ɪ-fi-lombe fy-ɪtʊ paapo i-kʊ-mal-a
trs: My husband, let's look for something to trap Hare, so that he gets caught and we kill him. He mustn't eat our maize again, because he's finishing it.' [Saliki and Hare]

src: ba-lɪnkw-inogon-a ʊ-kʊ-tɪ \textup{\lq\lq}tʊ-bʊʊk-e tʊ-k-iip-e ɪ-ly-ʊndʊ ɪ-ly-a kʊ-gelek-el-a kʊ-mwanya\textup{''} \textbf{ʊkʊtɪ} \textbf{ba}-\textbf{ngɪ}-\textbf{toony}-\textbf{el}-\textbf{igw}-\textbf{aga}

\lq I have told him that he should not be drinking too much.' [ET]
\lq Don't worry!' [overheard]

trs: \lq If he lacks something, he should not always borrow, he should try hard to get them.' [Types of tools in the home]

src: ijolo n̩-dw-iho lw-a ba-Nyakyʊsa ba-a-lɪ na=a-ka-jɪɪlo k-a n-kiikʊlʊ ʊ-kʊ-n-tiil-a ʊ-gwise gw-a n̩-dʊme, ʊ-jʊ tʊ-kʊ-tɪ n-kamwana.
trs: Long ago in the tradition of the Nyakyusa people they had a custom of the woman fearing the father of her husband, whom we call Nkamwana.

srcwordshtml: a-lɪ-nga-n-tiil-aga
trs: \lq Until the moment that he has paid her off so that she need not fear him any more.' [Should she save a life\ldots]
I'd rather stay at home (e.g. than join you in your activity).' [ET]
\lq I would like you to [i.e. please] cut off this banana.' [ET]

srcwordshtml: mu-lɪ-tʊ-tem-a=po
trs: \lq You guineafowls, please cut us a bit, too.' \citep[116]{BergerP1933}

src: ʊ-n-kangale a-a-t-ile: \textup{\lq\lq}eena, mu-gon-ile! mwe ba-ani?\textup{''} a-ba-anike ba-a-t-ile: \textup{\lq\lq}jo ʊ-swe, tʊ-sob-ile ɪ-n-jɪla j-ɪɪtʊ, \textbf{tʊ}-\textbf{lɪ}-\textbf{gon}-\textbf{a}=\textbf{mo}\textup{''}

src: kʊʊ-nongwa ɪ-jo lɪnga ʊ-n-nyambala a-bagiile ʊ-kʊ-tol-igw-a ʊ-kʊ-mmw-ag-a ʊ-n-kiikʊlʊ ʊ-gw-a kʊ-mmw-eg-a, a-ba-ndʊ \textbf{bi}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{mmw}-\textbf{inogon}-\textbf{aga} ʊ-mu-ndʊ ʊ-jo ʊkʊtɪ m-oolo pa-kʊ-bomb-a ɪ-m-bombo
trs: \lq Because of this, if a man is unable to get a woman to marry, people (will) think that this person is lazy in doing work.' %consequence in generics

src: a-ba-ndʊ bo a-bo bi-kʊ-bʊʊk-a kʊ-kw-asim-a ɪ-fi-bombelo ɪ-fy-a kʊ-bomb-el-a ɪ-m-bombo bo a-b-iinaabo ba-lɪ pa-kʊ-tʊʊsy-a
trs: \lq People like those go to borrow tools to do work with, when their fellows are resting.

src: bo ba-m-peele ɪ-fi-bombelo, a-ka-bagɪl-a ʊ-kʊ-bomb-el-a a-ka-balɪlo a-ka-tali
trs: \lq When they have given him tools, he cannot work with them for a long time.

src: lʊmo bo a-bomb-ile=po panandɪ \textbf{kw}-\textbf{ag}-\textbf{aga} a-b-eene na=fyo b-iis-ile kʊ-kw-eg-a
trs: \lq Or when he has worked for a little while, you will find they have come to take them back.

src: ʊ-ka-bagɪl-a ʊ-kʊ-kaan-il-a paapo fi-ka-j-a fy-ako, kʊ-gomosy-a
trs: \lq You cannot refuse, because they are not yours, you return them.
\lq If you delay in returning, they will withhold them always.
\lq And so you will be troubled by hunger and always be poor.
\makebox[\myl][l]{}(intended: \lq The train leaves in the afternoon.')
\makebox[\myl][l]{}(intended: \lq We do not work this Wednesday/on Wednesdays.')

src: taata ʊ-ne nalooli ɪ-fy-ʊm-a n-gaalɪ n-ga-kab-a ɪɪ-sala ɪ-jɪ. looli \textbf{n}-\textbf{gw}-\textbf{i}-\textbf{pʊʊl}-\textbf{aga}. n-gʊ-homb-a ɪ-fy-ʊma fi-la bo ʊlʊ n-iitiike m̩-ba-ndʊ
trs: Father [honorific], I still haven't obtained the brideprice. But I'll go after it. I'm paying that brideprice, just as I've now agreed to in front of people.' [Man and his in-law]

src: looli kalʊlʊ a-ka-a-meenye ʊ-kʊ-kwel-a m-mwanya, a-lɪnkʊ-lʊ-bʊʊl-a ʊ-lʊ-bʊbi a-lɪnkʊ-tɪ \textup{\lq\lq}ʊ-ne n-ga-many-a ʊ-kʊ-kwel-a m-mwanya\textup{''}
trs: But Hare could not climb up there, he told Spider ``I can't climb up there.''{}

src: ʊ-lʊ-bʊbi lʊ-lɪnkʊ-job-a ʊkʊtɪ \textup{\lq\lq}ʊ-nga-paasy-aga. ʊ-ne n-dɪ na=bo ʊ-bʊ-ʊsi ʊ-bʊ bʊ-kʊ-n-dwal-a ʊ-ne, mo \textbf{kw}-\textbf{end}-\textbf{anga}=\textbf{mo} nungwe\textup{''}
trs: Spider said ``Don't worry. I have a thread that carries me, you too will go on it.''{}' [Hare and Spider]

imtwordshtml: fut=1sg-prs-refl-alter.caus-fv
src: po a-pa n-dʊʊgeele. po a-n-gw-i-sanusy-a. a-ma-lʊndɪ gi-kʊ-keet-a kʊ-mwanya. po ʊ-gwe kʊ-lond-a ii-bwe, kʊ-kol-a. kʊ-bɪɪk-a ɪ-fi-lombe pa-mwanya pa-my-angʊ.
trs: \lq Here I stay, I'll turn myself over. The legs will look up. ‎‎You'll search for a stone and grasp it. You'll put maize on top of me.
\lq It'll resemble a grindstone. Then you shall grind.' [Monkey and Tortoise]

src: leelo lɪnga ʊ-gwise gw-a n-nyambala n̩-gaala bw-alwa kʊ-lʊ-sako ʊ-lʊ-nunu lɪnga ʊ-n-kasi gw-a mw-anaake i-kʊ-kɪnd-a pa-la ʊ-gwise gw-a n̩-dʊme i-kʊ-milw-a m-m-ɪɪsi jɪ-kʊ-j-a n-gafu kʊʊ-nongwa j-aa bʊ-gaala bw-alwa bw-ake.
trs: \lq But if the father of the man is a drunkard and if by chance the wife of his child passes by while the father of her husband is drowning in the water, it is difficult because of his drinking.

src: bʊle ʊ-n-kiikʊlʊ ʊ-jo \textbf{i}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{bomb}-\textbf{aga} fi-ki? [\dots] kalɪ \textbf{i}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{n̩}-\textbf{dek}-\textbf{aga} a-fw-ege m-m-ɪɪsi kʊʊ-nongwa j-aa kʊ-tiil-a ʊ-kʊ-kilani-a ɪ-m-baatɪko paapo a-ka-m̩-bonol-a?
trs: \lq What will the woman do? [\ldots] Will she really let him die in the water because of fearing to break the customs because he has not paid her off?' [Should she save a life \ldots]

src: kalʊlʊ a-aly-and-ile ʊ-kw-i-laalʊʊsy-a ʊkʊtɪ, \textup{\lq\lq}lɪlɪno ʊ-ne \textbf{n}-\textbf{gʊ}-\textbf{fw}-\textbf{aga} mu-n-k-iina mu-no? po n-ga-bagɪl-a. lɪnga jo mu-ndʊ ʊ-jʊ a-li=po pa-mwanya n-dek-e a-n-gog-ege.\textup{''}
trs: \lq Hare started to ask himself \lq\lq Am I to die now in this pit? I can't. If that's a person up there I'll let him kill me.''{}' [he goes on to jump out of the pit] [Saliki and Hare]
\lq Will you [promise me to] go after it?' [ET]
\makebox[\myl][l]{}(intended: \lq What will s/he do now?')

src: lɪnga n-aa-meenye \textbf{ngalɪ} n-ga-lɪm-a ɪ-ky-ɪnja ɪ-kɪ, paapo si-n-gʊfiifye fiijo ɪ-n-gambɪlɪ ɪ-si
trs: If I had known, I would not have farmed this year, because these monkeys have very much hurt me.' [Thieving monkeys]
\lq If there had been food on the table, we would have eaten it.' [ET]

src: fyobeene ba-a-tʊ-lek-ile, lɪnga ba-a-lɪ b-iitɪki b-iinɪɪtʊ ngalɪ ba-a-syele na=nʊʊswe. looli bo ba-a-sook-ile=po ba-a-nangiisye ʊkʊtɪ b-oosa ba-ka-a-lɪ b-iinɪɪtʊʊ
trs: \lq  but they went out, that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us'  [lit: \lq therefore they left us, if they had been believers like us, they would have remained with us \ldots'] (1 John 2: 19)

src: n-gʊ-ba-syʊkw-a jʊʊba na taata, looli n-gʊ-sʊʊbɪl-a ʊkʊtɪ \textbf{lɪnga} ba-a-j-anga=po ʊlʊ, \textbf{a}=\textbf{ngalɪ} bi-kw-i-tuukɪfy-a ʊ-swe
trs: \lq I miss Mama and Papa, but I think if they were here they would be proud of us now.' [Kande's story]\footnotemark
\lq We would be eating (but we are still waiting for the guests).' [ET]
\lq We would have eaten (but we are still waiting for the guests).' [ET]
